headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Tesla, Intel, Nvidia, Affirm, Micron, Norwegian Cruise, Netflix, and More
summary: Tesla falls Monday with shares of the electric-vehicle maker on an eight-week losing streak, Nvidia’s GTC AI conference begins Monday, and Affirm stock tumbles as Walmart chooses competitor Klarna as provider of buy-now-pay-later loans.

headline: Intel, Norwegian Cruise Line, Science Applications: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman covers the biggest stock moves in this Market Minute, including Intel's (INTC) stock reaction ahead of new CEO Lip-Bu Tan to take up the mantle of chief executive on Tuesday, March 18; JPMorgan's upgrade of Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH) shares; and Science Applications International (SAIC) moves higher on its fourth quarter earnings results and full-year profit guidance. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line upgraded at JPMorgan after conference
summary: Investing.com -- Norwegian Cruise Line was lifted to Overweight from Neutral at JPMorgan on Monday, with the bank citing strong demand trends and resilience in discretionary spending despite macroeconomic concerns.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line stock jumps on bullish JPMorgan call
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH) shares pop after JPMorgan analysts upgraded the stock despite signs of weakening consumer demand. Brad Smith and Madison Mills report more on this analyst coverage on the cruise operator. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.
